newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's BBV surges on good results.
newsitem.headline: Spain's BBV surges on good results.

text.p: Shares in Spain's Banco Bilbao Vizcaya rallied in mid-morning trade on Tuesday as traders focussed on the quality of the bank's nine-month results.
AT 0935 GMT, BBV was up 60 pesetas to 6,110, while the Ibex-35 index of leading stocks was down 5.26 points, 0.12 percent to 4,397.35.

"The net (profit) figure was in line with expectations, but the quality of (BBV's) results was really impressive, much better than forecast. They've hit their year-end non-performing loans ratio already," said a trader at a European bank in Madrid.
Another trader forecast BBV could hit 6,500 pesetas in the short term.
On Monday BBV announced net attributable profit of 70.5 billion pesetas in the first nine months of the year, up 26.5 percent versus the same period a year earlier.
BBV's provisions for doubtful debts increased to 100.9 percent, and the bank said it expects profits after minorities to grow 20 percent by year-end.
Dealers said other banks were higher in sympathy, ahead of their results. Banco Central Hispano was up 85 pesetas to 3,005, and Santander added 60 pesetas to 5,250.
"There was a lot of talk about narrower margins in Spain, but from these results you can tell that that's not true," the trader said.
A second trader at a Spanish brokerage said there had been switching out of electric utilities into banks after a strong run in the former sector.

"Investors have no-where to go after the rise in electricals. People are now looking at what other sectors to get into, and they're taking a bit of money out of electricals and putting it into banks."
He highlighted strong results expected from Banco Santander, due to report on October 28.
BBV's business both at home and abroad was going very well, despite strong competition in Spain, dealers said.
"They've done really well in South America where there's potential, but also on the domestic side," one trader said.
